bibl.title: Letter from Gilbert Grosvenor to Philip Showalter Hench, December 24, 1946

div1.p: Grosvenor thanks Hench for the snapshots of the Walter Reed Memorial Association meeting. Grosvenor treasures his honorary degree from Lafayette College.

div1.head: Letter from Gilbert Grosvenor to Philip Showalter Hench, December 24, 1946
div1.opener:
TELEPHONE
DISTRICT 3330
CABLE ADDRESS
NATOCOSOC, WASHINGTON
National Geographic Magazine
WASHINGTON 6. D. C.
December 24, 1946
GILBERT GROSVENOR, EDITOR
File
see
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I am very glad to receive your letter and appreciate
most warmly the trouble you have taken to send me enlargements
of the snapshots you made at the recent meeting of the
Walter Reed Memorial Association. I think your pictures are
remarkably good.

I value the privilege of meeting you and the other
distinguished members of the group, and shall treasure this
picture of them.

I am much interested to note that your middle name is
Showalter and that you are a cousin of the late W. J. Showalter,
a dear friend and brilliant associate of mine for many years on
the National Geographic Society's staff.

Also, I treasure my honorary degree from Lafayette
College given me at the suggestion of the late William Mather Lewis,
for whom I had great admiration. Perhaps you may not know that
before he went to Lafayette he was President of The George
Washington University of this city.

I have not had the privilege of meeting the new President
of Lafayette, but look forward to becoming acquainted with him
before long.

I wish you and yours a Merry Christmas and a Happy
New Year.
With kindest regards, and many thanks
div1.closer:
Yours sincerely, Gilbert Grosvenor Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota
